title: Betting firm GVC offers about 908 mln stg for rival Bwin.Party
text:

Thu, Jul 9, 2015, 07:55 BST - UK Markets open in 5 mins. Betting firm GVC offers about 908 mln stg for rival Bwin.Party Reuters - UK Focus â€“ 13 minutes ago 0.00 
(Adds details, background) 
July 9 (Reuters) - Online gambling company Bwin.Party Digital Entertainment Plc said smaller rival GVC Holdings Plc had offered to buy the company in cash and stock, valuing it at about 908 million pounds ($1.4 billion). 
GVC's offer of 110 pence per share represents an 11 percent premium to Bwin.Party stock's Wednesday close. 
Bwin said its board had considered GVC's proposal and had determined to work with the company to finalise the offer over the coming days. 
In May, GVC Holdings (Other OTC: GMVHF - news ) submitted a bid for Bwin.Party, which put itself up for sale last year. 
Bwin, created by the merger of sports betting group bwin and online poker group PartyGaming in 2011, had a market value of about 816 million pounds as of Wednesday close, nearly triple that of GVC. 
The offer value is based on about 825.5 million shares outstanding as of June 30, according to a company filing. 
The Financial Times reported on Tuesday that GVC Holdings has offered to buy Bwin.Party for about 900 million pounds. 
($1 = 0.6494 pounds) (Reporting by Aastha Agnihotri in Bengaluru; Editing by Gopakumar Warrier)
